job description:
Company
The Boeing Company

Job ID
  • *********
Date posted
08/30/2018

Location
Renton Washington United States

Job Description

Boeing Commercial Airplanes is seeking an experienced Product Data Management Engineer to support 7 series engineering in Renton, Washington.

Job Responsibilities include but not limited to:

Manages BCA Boeing driven production airplane changes via the Production Revision Record (PRR) process for airplane programs. Supports design engineering from airplane change concept to airplane change incorporation into production.
Develops and maintains project schedules, gathers and analyzes work statements to support overall project development and coordinate with change board for committing change into the production system; ensures products meets technical, regulatory and company requirements.
Coordinates and maintains relationships with Finance Estimating, Program Planning, Change Board, Engineering, Airplane Certification groups, and Supplier Management to ensure integration of all impacted parties required to support Boeing Driven Change.
Tracks and reports data to monitor adherence to regulatory, data configuration and contractual requirements; supports/conducts audits and reviews to ensure products meet requirements.
Leads others, directs and manages all phases of developing project plan to support Engineering Change Request Planning Phase and PRR Commitment Phase using change management process and tools, and project management standards.
Works under minimal direction.

Engineering Change Coordinator (ECC) Roles and Responsibilities:

Leads Boeing Driven Change (PRR) resolution efforts in support of the change management process by working with ENGR, Change Board, Bus Ops and Change Board Supplier Management to ensure change solution is ready for commitment.
Responsible for understanding the design/factory/supplier issue and helps to facilitate technical review meetings with affected ENGR groups and stakeholders.
Provides project management discipline to ensure quality and schedule performance.
Conducts work statement review; input work statements for DE if/as required.
Publishes and maintain Engineering Change Memos (ECM)
Communicate relevant change information/issues across airplane value stream (i.e., Management, ENGR, Bus Ops, Supplier Mgmt, Factory, BDS)
Utilize tools to process committed changes (ECAS/IBEX, ACMS, REDARS, PDM)
Boeing is the world's largest aerospace company and leading manufacturer of commercial airplanes and defense, space and security systems. We are engineers and technicians. Skilled scientists and thinkers. Bold innovators and dreamers. Join us, and you can build something better for yourself, for our customers and for the world.

Division

737 Program

Relocation Assistance Available

No. Relocation assistance is not a negotiable benefit.

Qualifications

This position must meet Export Control compliance requirements, therefore a US Person as defined by 22 C.F.R. 120.15 is required. US Person includes US Citizen, lawful permanent resident, refugee, or asylee.

Basic Qualifications (Required Skills/Experience):

Bachelor, Master or Doctorate of Science degree from an accredited course of study, in engineering, computer science, mathematics, physics or chemistry.

Preferred Qualifications (Desired Skills/Experience):

Familiarity of committed change management process.
Effective communication (written/verbal).
Build positive relationships, fosters a collaborative environment.
Proactive with strong attention to details; proven organizational/project management skills.
Ability to juggle day-to-day tasks with emergent/critical work.
Engineering Configuration - general knowledge and understanding of the technical considerations to integration of the product software/hardware
Design, Manufacturing or Production experience.
Knowledge of product life-cycle.

Typical Education/Experience:

Degree and typical experience in engineering classification: Bachelor's and 5 or more years' experience, Master's degree with 3 or more years' experience or PhD degree with experience. Bachelor, Master or Doctorate of Science degree from an accredited course of study, in engineering, computer science, mathematics, physics or chemistry. ABET is the preferred, although not required, accreditation standard.

Experience Level

Individual Contributor

Job Type

Standard

Travel

No

Contingent Upon Program Award

No

Union

Yes

Job Code
